node.title: Morrison losing his WeChat account shows our politicians know little about dealing with China
node.alt: Thumbnail of Scott Morrison on WeChat.
node.description: The rhetoric from his ministers about "foreign interference" could alienate the very community the Prime Minister had hoped to win over.
node.content:
["Prime Minister Scott Morrison had an official account on WeChat, but he didn't own it.", "Last week, several Liberal MPs called for a\u00a0boycott of WeChat, one of China's largest social media platforms, after the account was reportedly\u00a0\"hijacked\".", "The incident comes as\u00a0relations with Beijing are at an\u00a0historic\u00a0low\u00a0and\u00a0right before the arrival of China's new ambassador to Canberra.", "Morrison set up the account to better engage with Chinese-Australian voters ahead of the 2019 election.", "But, ahead of the 2022\u00a0election, he has lost control of the account, disconnecting him from\u00a076,000 followers.", "On top of this, the rhetoric about\u00a0\"foreign interference\"\u00a0from his ministers could alienate the very community he had hoped to win over.", "
What's the difference between WeChat and Weixin?\u00a0
", "WeChat is a super-app from tech giant Tencent that has more than 1.2 billion active users around the world, about 1 million of them in Australia.\u00a0", "However, many Australians\u00a0don't know that WeChat is actually\u00a0two apps in one system \u2014\u00a0WeChat and Weixin.\u00a0", "", "
Like TikTok, WeChat has a version of the platform \u2014 Weixin \u2014 which is subject to local laws and censorship.(AP: Mark\u00a0Schiefelbein)
", "WeChat is not just the English name of Weixin, but a specific app that targets overseas users who register\u00a0their accounts with non-Chinese mobile numbers.", "Weixin, which\u00a0is incorporated in the same platform, is for users with a Chinese mobile phone number. It is where China's laws and censorship take effect.", "It is very similar to what another Chinese tech giant \u2014\u00a0Byte Dance \u2014 does for its apps TikTok and Douyin. The latter is known as the Chinese version that is only geographically available in Chinese app stores.", "So why didn't Morrison just get a WeChat account, rather than Weixin,\u00a0and avoid the risk?\u00a0", "It's because\u00a0foreign politicians are not eligible for\u00a0official WeChat accounts \u2014 which can send alerts to followers.\u00a0But they can still get an account via a Chinese national on Weixin, which is a grey area in the platform's policy.", "While he could have a personal WeChat account, it's a bit like having a personal Facebook account \u2014 you can interact with friends only.\u00a0", "In comparison, an\u00a0official WeChat account on Weixin is more like a Facebook page people can subscribe to.\u00a0", "On Weixin, the Prime Minister's official account\u00a0is subject to Beijing's censorship \u2014 and in fact,\u00a0one of his posts was censored in December 2020.\u00a0", "Mr Morrison's Weixin account was registered under the name of a Chinese citizen known only as Mr Ji\u00a0in January 2019, before our last election.", "It is unclear who made the decision to operate an account linked to a Chinese citizen's ID \u2014\u00a0the Prime Minister's Office declined to answer the ABC's questions about this in 2019.", "It's worth noting the leader for the Labor Party, Anthony Albanese, also has an account under a Chinese citizen's name.", "It appears a Chinese\u00a0agency registered the account on the Prime Minister's behalf, circumventing the platform's rules and\u00a0operating in a grey zone that poses risks for both Morrison and the Chinese citizen.", "RMIT associate professor Haiqing Yu said while some people might interpret the incident as an act of censorship by the Chinese government, \"other people say this is a sign of Morrison's incompetence.\"", "\"Why didn't his advisors advise him at the very beginning \u2014 his account was a Weixin account, not a WeChat account?\" she said.", "
Was it really hijacked?\u00a0
", "Highlighting these inappropriate registration methods doesn't in any way\u00a0legitimise China's censorship or surveillance in the digital space.", "But choosing to set up the account in this way\u00a0may once again hurt Australia's national image and have consequences for the agency in China.", "", "
The Prime Minister lost control of his WeChat account, which has been renamed \"Australian Chinese New Life\".\u00a0(ABC News: Adam Kennedy)
", "The Chinese citizen who set up the account could be punished or questioned by Beijing, as\u00a0their operations could be\u00a0interpreted as risking China's national security on a heavily monitored and censored app.", "Beijing could also accuse the Prime Minister of infringing on their digital sovereignty.\u00a0", "Because Morrison didn't own the account \u2014\u00a0Mr Ji did \u2014 the Chinese national was entitled to transfer the ownership of the account to anyone else, according to Weixin's policy.", "However, Weixin and WeChat's policies\u00a0do\u00a0state that\u00a0official accounts shouldn't be sold, which appears to have happened in this case.\u00a0", "Several Liberal MPs are calling for a boycott of WeChat, while Senator James Paterson labelled it an example of \"foreign interference\".", "\"We cannot allow a foreign authoritarian government to interfere in our democracy and set the terms of public debate in Australia,\" he said.\u00a0", "Parent company Tencent said there was\u00a0no evidence of hacking and it appeared\u00a0to be an ownership dispute.", "There have been concerns about Chinese foreign interference in the past, and it could be the case again this time, but so far\u00a0there is\u00a0no evidence that the Chinese government moved to interfere or deplatform the Prime Minister.\u00a0", "Ironically, Beijing could accuse Australia of foreign interference\u00a0given\u00a0our politicians broke the rules on Weixin, with the aim of spreading Australian propaganda.\u00a0", "That's not to say Beijing is innocent in this affair \u2014 just to point out that the Chinese Communist Party could take Australian politicians to task for side-stepping the rules.\u00a0", "
Disengaging the Australian Chinese community
", "In his first post on the platform, Morrison said he\u00a0\"hoped to establish closer channels of communication with Chinese Australians through the WeChat account\".", "\"I attach great importance to the contribution made by the Chinese Australians to our country,\" Morrison wrote.", "", "
Thousands of Chinese Australians use the platform, but the latest incident could amp up anxiety over WeChat's use.(Unsplash: Kate Trifo)
", "Boycotting WeChat now is not a solution\u00a0\u2014 and it could inflame anxieties about the platform and sideline the Australian Chinese community.\u00a0", "With almost all Western social media platforms\u00a0blocked by Beijing, WeChat is\u00a0the last platform where everyday Chinese Australians can have daily conversations with their families inside China's Great Firewall.", "Jumping to the conclusion of \"foreign interference\"\u00a0exposed that our government is neither capable of dealing with China, nor the Chinese Australian community.", "In WeChat groups where Chinese Australians discuss politics, some questioned why Australian politicians rushed to make claims\u00a0before they had solid evidence.", "One user said the Liberal party members who made the claims about foreign interference acted like \"a thief posing as a judge\" because of the unorthodox way Morrison's team had set up the official page.", "The ABC has approached Morrison's office for comment.", "The accusation of foreign interference could also hurt the interest of thousands of businesses on the platform \u2014 including retail companies such as David Jones and Myer \u2014 which invested in\u00a0creating\u00a0business channels to connect with Chinese consumers.", "", "
Gladys Liu should have called for regulating WeChat for the sake of her voters.(ABC News: Luke Stephenson)
", "Gladys Liu, the only Chinese-speaking MP in Australia, has said she won't use the platform until the issue is resolved,\u00a0which could impact her ability to serve a\u00a0community that relies heavily on WeChat.", "Concerns over WeChat's security issues and censorship mechanisms have existed for a long time, and Liu should have called for regulating WeChat for the sake of her voters.", "Calls\u00a0to regulate\u00a0the Chinese social media platform have gone unheard by the Australian Parliament, even though US tech giants such as Facebook were subject to new Australian regulations to tackle fake news last year.", "The rhetoric over the fracas also casts a shadow over the platform, which many Chinese Australians use not just to communicate but\u00a0for banking and shopping, at a time when the community has already been caught in the middle of geopolitical tensions and pandemic-fuelled racism.\u00a0", "The truth is the account was never owned by Morrison. Acquiring it through a backchannel\u00a0and then implying nefarious intent from the Chinese government\u00a0without evidence when he lost control of it, could push away the voters he was trying to draw in."]
